greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 0, and for n > 1, a(n) = 2*a(A332893(n)) + [n == 3 (mod 4)].
comment: Base-2 expansion of a(n) encodes the steps where numbers of the form 4k+3 are encountered when map x -> A332893(x) is iterated down to 1, starting from x=n. See the binary tree illustrated in A332815.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 04 2020
